abstract: Reporter's Notebook; viewpoints vary in case of gang of motorcyclists who assaulted driver on West Side Highway in 2013 despite wealth of evidence in form of video recordings taken by witnesses and participants; case, in which electrician Robert Sims and New York City Police Detective Wojciech Braszczok are standing trial, addresses larger issue of wild motorcycle rallies that occasionally disrupt city.
lead_paragraph: Prosecutors are portraying bikers as a lawless mob to counter the defense argument that it was a Range Rover driver who started a highway conflict.

headline.main: Opposing Views of Menace at Trial in Motorcycle Assault
headline.print_headline: Two Wheels or Four? Opposing Views of Menace at Bikers’ Assault Trial

snippet: Prosecutors are portraying bikers as a lawless mob to counter the defense argument that it was a Range Rover driver who started a highway conflict.
